sanskrit_verse:
सर्वेण तु प्रयत्नेन गिरिदुर्गं समाश्रयेत् ।
एषां हि बाहुगुण्येन गिरिदुर्गं विशिष्यते ॥ ७.७१॥
transliteration:
sarveṇa tu prayatnena giridurgaṃ samāśrayeta |
eṣāṃ hi bāhuguṇyena giridurgaṃ viśiṣyate || 7.71||
sph_interpretive_translation: By every means of effort, one should resort to a mountain fortress; indeed, among these, a mountain fortress excels by virtue of its strategic strength.
jurisprudential_principles: Capacity-based responsibility rooted in resource optimization
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity requires protection THEN entity MUST utilize maximum available structural defense.
IF threat level exceeds local capacity THEN entity MUST seek superior defensive terrain.
IF protection mechanism offers higher survivability THEN it MUST be selected over lesser alternatives.
IF defensive posture aligns with natural law THEN it SHALL be prioritized in all security planning.
supreme_court_application: In matters of national or individual security, the Supreme Court shall recognize that optimal protection derives from alignment with inherent strengths. Legal decisions must reflect capacity-conscious choices where the highest form of safeguarding takes precedence, especially when existential threats arise.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: This verse establishes pramāṇa-based causality: superior positioning leads to greater safety without inflicting harm. It reflects anupūrvaśaḥ — sequential manifestation of intelligent alignment. Responsibility lies in recognizing and assuming such advantageous conditions, not in retaliatory action. The alignment is restorative, not punitive.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Ensure full assessment of available protective structures.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Mandate adoption of strongest feasible defense.
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Align human and material resources with optimal sheltering systems.
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Reinforce societal cohesion through unified strategic preparedness.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the Source of Dharma. Protection flows from alignment with natural strength. Justice restores integrity through conscious choice. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns as the ultimate adjudicator.
